alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Branch; Cass; Hillsdale; St. Joseph (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 19 at 6:07AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Risk of ice jams and elevated river levels possible next week... Increased chances for flooding of rivers and streams exist from Monday through next week. Runoff from rainfall and melting snow beginning Monday through the remainder of the week may be heavy enough to cause rises on rivers and streams making minor flooding possible on some rivers. With the recent arctic airmass and very cold temperatures over the weekend, an increase in ice coverage on area rivers and streams is expected. This increased ice production may cause blockage in water flow and produce localized flooding near and upstream of ice jams. Along with the combination of increased rainfall and potential snow melting next week, river levels may become further elevated and make chances of ice jam development and minor flooding greater. Ice jams may cause additional rises on area rivers with little to no warning. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons with interests along area rivers should closely monitor the latest forecasts.

area.areaDesc: Berrien; Branch; Cass; Hillsdale; St. Joseph
